title: General Cleaning
description: General facility cleaning requirements including waste management, debris control, cleaning tool management, housekeeping standards, and prevention of cross-contamination during cleaning activities

requirements.question: Are waste and garbage frequently removed from production and storage areas?

Are floor drains and waste trap systems constructed and located so they can be easily cleaned, do they appear clean, free from odors, in good repair, and flow in a manner that prevents contamination (e.g., from high to low risk areas, from high risk directly to drain system)?
Do high level areas, including overhead pipes, ducts, conduit, etc., appear clean?
Are plastic strip curtains maintained in good condition, kept clean and mounted so that the tips are not touching the floor?
Is personal protection equipment (PPE) for the sanitation crew in good condition and stored to prevent cross contamination to raw products, work in progress, ingredients, finished goods or packaging?
Is cleaning equipment maintained clean and stored properly?
Is cleaning equipment identified in order to prevent potential cross-contamination issues (e.g., production, maintenance, outside, restroom equipment)?
Are all items used for sanitation appropriate for their designated purpose (e.g., no steel wool, metal bristles, etc.)?
Are toilet facilities and hand washing stations clean?
Are worker break facilities clean, including microwaves and refrigerators, and no rotting or out of date foodstuffs?
Is the maintenance shop organized, with equipment and spares stored in a neat and tidy fashion?
Are internal transport vehicles (e.g., forklifts, bobcats, pallet jacks, carts, floor cleaners, etc.), clean, do not emit toxic fumes and are being used in a sanitary manner?
Are shipping trucks clean and in good condition?
